div.title: These settings will be used to create Realization Entries on Invoices or Accounts.

div.div: If you select this option Realization Journal Entries will be created for the Invoices. Leave option unselected if you only want to use the Realization Ledger for the invoices. Please read all the information below prior to use this option.

This Journal will be used to book the Journal Entries for the Realization Journal Entries of Invoices. Debit and Credit Accounts in the Journal will be used to book the Gains/Losses in Foreign Exchange Differences. It is advisable to use Memorandum accounts in the Debit/Credit accounts in this Journal.

This Fiscal Position will be used to map the accounts that will be booked in the Realization Entries. If no account is found in the fiscal position for the account in the Revaluation Ledger Item then the one in the Item will be used. Counterparts for these accounts will be fetched from the ones in the Invoice Realization Journal. It is hugely recommended to use Memorandum accounts in the mapping. Be advised that doing otherwise you could be booking twice the Gains/Losses in Foreign Exchange Difference.

div.title: These settings will be used to create Realization Entries on Invoices or Accounts.

div.div: If you select this option Realization Journal Entries will be created for the Accounts. Leave option unselected if you only want to use the Realization Ledger for the accounts. As accounts do not realize by themselves as opposed by Invoices it is advisable to check this option.

This Journal will be used to book the Journal Entries for the Realization Journal Entries of Accounts. Debit and Credit Accounts in the Journal will be used to book the Gains/Losses in Foreign Exchange Differences.

This Fiscal Position will be used to map the accounts that will be booked in the Realization Entries. If no account is found in the fiscal position for the account in the Revaluation Ledger Item then the one in the Item will be used. Counterparts for these accounts will be fetched from the ones in the Account Realization Journal.
